page.title: 14HEBRIDEAN WORKSHOP
page.content: The Hebridean Workshop, Aberdeen The workshop was opened in November 1983 and it is rapidly becoming very well known. It has 2 aims, to help in the survival of a rare breed of sheep and to make a profit to help with the upkeep of these sheep. Rare Hebridean sheep and Black Welsh sheep thrive on the small farm. These sheep have a high quality brown/black fleece. This wool is used in a small cottage industry. Two women design garments. The wool is spun and woven by hand and machine. They produce high quality woollen products including jumpers, hats, scarves, aprons, tea towels, T-shirts and wall hangings.
